title: Heads and Tales : or, Anecdotes and Stories of Quadrupeds and Other Beasts, Chiefly Connected with Incidents in the Histories of More or Less Distinguished Men.
author: Various
snippet: Captain Medwin records, in one of his conversations, that the poetremarked that it was troublesome to travel about with so much live anddead stock as he did, and adds--"I don't like to leave behind me any ofmy pets, that have been accumulating since I came on the Continent.
